title: Chelsea stars Eden Hazard, Thibaut Coutois, N'Golo Kante and Kurt Zouma take on real life Fifa 17 skill game
text:
Chelsea stars Eden Hazard, Thibaut Courtois, N'Golo Kante and Kurt Zouma take on real life FIFA 17 skill test It's Team Belgium (Hazard, Courtois, Batshuayi) vs Team Rest of the World (Kante, Zouma, Chalobah) Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now The Belgian contingent take on their teammates Share this video   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Sometimes the most fun you have on Fifa 17 is shortly before the game starts - when you play the skill games. 
There's passing, shooting, defending, set-pieces and even dribbling. 
Admit it, when you're playing against your mate, how often do you forget about the actual game you're supposed to be playing and instead get caught competing in the skill challenges? 
We've all done it. 
Well six lucky stars down at Chelsea 's training ground were fortunate enough to play a skill game recently... in real life. It's just like the game! (Photo: EA SPORTS FIFA /Youtube) 
Eden Hazard, Thibaut Courtois and Michy Batshuayi were put into one team, Team Belguim. While N'Golo Kante, Kurt Zouma and Nathaniel Chalobah were grouped into another, Team Rest of the World. 
In three rounds, the boys had to collect as many points as possible by kicking the balls into the baskets. Eden and co are less than impressed with Batshuayi's attempt (Photo: EA SPORTS FIFA /Youtube) 
It's 1200 for the big basket, 1600 for the medium-sized one and 2000 for the smaller target. 
At the end of round one, Team Rest of the World lead 0-1600 - thanks to Kante's excellent aim. Zouma on point (Photo: EA SPORTS FIFA /Youtube) 
And things don't get much better for Team Belgium. At the end of round two, Hazard is the only one to have acquired points for his side and the group trail 1600-4800. 
But a late surge from the round three underdogs sees Hazard, Courtois and Batshuayi all score points. 
With the scores standing at 6000-4800 to Team Belgium, it's all on Chalobah to either draw or win the game for Team Rest of the World. The final scoreboard (Photo: EA SPORTS FIFA /Youtube) 
The 22-year-old steps like a champ and gets a stunning 2000 pointer. Team Rest of the World win!
